text: US ARMY MAJOR FURNISS mans the projector as he briefs 100 UNIFORMED MEN - Sergeants, Lieutenants - in a FIELD TENT:

Gentlemen. The footage you're about to see was intercepted on its way to Berlin, intended for Himmler. Command is giving it highest priority. Film feeds through the projector, then on to a screen-- ON THE SCREEN - We see a large LAB, location unknown. Fac the camera MOS is DOCTOR HUGO BRUEL: 50, beaming proudly.

The doctor and his subjects are unknown. G-2 believes the lab is somewhere in Normandy. ON THE SCREEN - Behind Bruel is a row of NAKED HUMAN SUBJ on HOSPITAL BEDS. Bruel, syringe in hand, approaches one- REVERSE TO FURNISS' MEN - watching... as something on the screen shocks them. We drift along the rows in this tent, face after face - American soldiers, aghast, sickened. Th We land on SERGEANT GUY RENSIN. He's a Jumpmaster, leathe tough, unflappable. But even he is tightening as he watch that screen - has to swallow hard to keep from gagging.
Your men needn't know about this; liberating France is burden enough. But if you find that lab tonight, Command wants it and all of its assets SEIZED, including the Doctor.
We PUSH IN ON RENSIN - disgust on his face - as:

His "experiment" could damn well mean our losing this war. And maybe the free world. The 16 mm. film runs out. Rensin nods soberly. We CUT TO: Darkness. Silence. An uncomfortable stillness... Then the sound of BOOTS on gravel - as we SMASH TO:

American boys, PARATROOPERS of the 82ND AIRBORNE, heading death itself - eyes down, throats tight, no one talking - they're herded toward idling C-47's on an English airstri Sgt. Rensin now stands at the CARGO DOOR of one of the C- 47's. On its nose is a drawing of a Betty Grable body and words "My Gal Val". Rensin barks at us:

Let's move! Let's move! Keep up with your stick! SUPER: "Slapton Sands, Uppottery England. June 5, 1944" THOUSANDS OF SOLDIERS marching toward HUNDREDS OF PLANES. Untested young men, here to save Europe from the Nazis - among them we find PFC. ED BOYCE. He's 24. And terrified. Boyce is from Des Moines, used to be a mechanic; his fait God runs bone-deep. But he's just a boy, and he knows it. His face charcoaled black, his breaths shallow, he keeps with his "stick" - the 18 GUYS he'll be jumping with - ea bearing 120 pounds of gear. It's nearly MIDNIGHT. They pass by BRITISH SOLDIERS of an ANTI-AIRCRAFT BATTERY salute - a few of them crying; that gets Boyce's attentio He and his stick reach Rensin at the CARGO DOOR of that C Every paratrooper needs to be pushed into the plane by fe soldiers (the gear they carry is that heavy.)
In! In! In! Let's go! We're dropping in on Herr Hitler this evening! Boyce arrives at the cargo door. The soldier who just cli aboard in front of him turns with a confident grin:
Need a hand, Ed? Meet CPL. LEWIS FORD, offering his hand as if he were hel us onto a trolley on Main Street. Ford is 27, from Brookl matinee-idol handsome, unshakable - even now.
Thanks, Lew. Ford is Boyce's idol, since Basic. Boyce takes his hand. pulls. Two Soldiers behind Boyce push. Then:

Boyce takes his seat on a bench lining the fuselage wall among a dozen SILENT PARATROOPERS, so wedged in that nobo can move, each man bearing that same 120 pounds of gear: They carry grenades, mines, rifles, .45's, TNT, bayonets, rations, main and emergency parachutes, musette bags. For beside Boyce, checks Boyce's gear. Boyce pale with fear.
You okay?
Yeah.

Hey. This is what we came here for. (re: Boyce's gear) You're good. Me? Boyce checks Ford's gear - including the DETONATOR on For belt - but they both know he's good to go. MORE PARATROOPERS board. Ford casually taps the shoulder PFC. JULIAN ROSENFELD (from Oak Park, Illinois).
Rosenfeld. Cigarettes for chocolate? Rosenfeld ponders it... as PFC TYLER GRIEB looks on, amus
Ford, you must love chocolate.
It's to win over the locals. (to Rosenfeld: ) Deal?

Sure. Done - cigarettes for chocolate. Boyce eyes them with won “How can you be so nonchalant?! We're about to DIE." Then A MEDIC stumbles clumsily aboard, his helmet falling off. This is D.F. GRUNAUER. He grabs the helmet, finds a seat. well aware that he's being stared at. By everyone. PFC. PETE GURKIN (23, from Houston) eyes Grunauer... then
What happened to Briggs?
He fell outside the PX, broke his ankle. So they reassigned me. Name's D.F. Grunauer. No one's saying, "Welcome aboard!" So Ford extends a hand
Lew Ford.
Ed Boyce. Grunauer shakes their hands, gratefully. But PRIVATE LYLE TIBBET, (24, from Cincinnati, an asshole), chimes in:
Hold it, hold it. We're jumpin' with a Medic from the JV team?
It's okay. Just don't get shot. Some tight laughs, even from Grunauer. The whole stick is aboard now. Jumpmaster Rensin climbs in - shouting:
In your seats, Ladies.
What's our target, Sarge?

Radio-jamming tower on top of a church in Cielblanc. Gotta knock it down so our planes can give air cover to the invasion forces comin' off the beaches. Command wants it destroyed by 0-900. .»+.-as Ford pulls a SILK MAP from his coat, showing Grun the beaches of NORMANDY... Omaha, Juno... leading to ROAD 13... leading to a tiny dot: the village of CIELBLANC--
Figures the Nazis'd put it on top of a church. Godless bastards. They outlawed Christmas, ya know. That's MORTON DAWES, from Portland. Boyce shakes his head
That tower is the lynchpin of the Jerries' local air-defense. If it (MORE )

isn't down by the time our airstrikes begin at 0-900, the result is gonna be a lot of lost planes and dead G.I.'s never makin' it off those beaches. We can expect it to be defended aggressively. Understood? (no one speaks...) Synchronize your watches. It's exactly midnight on my mark... Mark.
Every paratrooper just synchronized his watch... JUMPMASTER RENSIN (CONT’D) Gurkin, Grieb - you got your explosives?
Yes, Sergeant!
Ford! You got your detonator?
Yes, Sergeant!
Rosenfeld! You got the spare?
Yes, Sergeant!
Keep a tight grip on it, Rosenfeld.
Yeah, pretend it's your pecker. Dawes and Rosenfeld are pals. So Rosenfeld chuckles, as:
If you wouldn't mind, I'm tryin' to win a war here.
Lemme hear your crickets. The guys pull DIME-STORE METAL CRICKETS from their trouse testing them out: CLICK-CLACK, CLICK-CLACK.
Everybody know the checkwords? The guys nod. Rensin hands out a PILL to each guy.
These are for air-sickness. Take 'em. The men look thrown, but they do as told - except for For who crushes his pill under his boot - unseen by Rensin.
You're not gonna take it?
They make you sleepy. You wanna sleep through this?
The truth? Ford smiles fondly. Rensin pulls a MEMO from his jacket:

From General Eisenhower: "Soldiers, Sailors, and Airmen of the Allied Expeditionary Force! You are about to embark upon Operation Overlord, the Great Crusade toward which we have striven these many months. The eyes of the world are upon you. Good Luck! And let us beseech the blessing of Almighty God upon this great and noble undertaking." That lands on the somber faces in here...as the C-47 lurc forward, bouncing noisily. Taxiing... Boyce lowers his head in prayer, his eyes shut tight (sev of the men in here do likewise). Ford regards him, then:
Send up an extra one for me, will ya Ed? So I'm covered?
We look down on the plane as it taxis, engines roaring. I comes to a stop, third in line for take-off.

ENGINE NOISE fills the air. The bench beneath us shakes a the plane in front of us takes off. Boyce keeps praying. Ford pulls a GREASE PENCIL from his trousers, leans forwa and writes something on the fuselage floor - as this bulk beast begins to move again, accelerating down the runway.
Most of the paratroopers are praying now. We bounce arou catching glimpses of PFC. CHASE, Gurkin, and Rosenfeld:
God, just let me hit the ground safely. I'll take it from there.
Lord, Thy will be done, but if I am to die tonight, please let me die like a man.

I'll be home soon, Ma. Everything rumbling, bouncing, every paratrooper tight. W land on Boyce, as his eyes open... and he sees what Ford wrote on the floor of this fuselage: "82nd Airborne. We came to liberate France. June 5, 1944.

Amen. The C-47 hits lift-off speed. Boyce petrified. Ford's a r The C-47 lifts off. Loud and clunky. Men rock back. On ea face: "This is it - not a training run. The German Army's waiting out there." The C-47's walls now feel like paper.
Think it's time we made our swap.

Yeah, okay. Boyce pulls a BULKY ENVELOPE from his jacket, addressed t "Mr. & Mrs. Irvin Boyce" with an address in Des Moines. ( plane is rising now - 50 feet, 100 feet, 200 feet - LOUDL Ford pulls out a bulky envelope that reads "Mrs. Arthur Ford," with an address in Brooklyn. They exchange envelop
Threw my class ring in there, figured they'd want it. You?

My Old Man's lighter. Promised my ma she'd get it back in one piece. Boyce nods. Ford looks around... at the faces inside this plane - young boys scared out of their wits, grim as hell It offends him, for reasons he can't even articulate. So
Ya know what? Hell with this. He grabs his own envelope back from Boyce, and hands the other envelope back to Boyce.
Nobody's dyin' tonight. I won't have it. That's that. The C-47 climbs noisily, as:
"My Gal Val" takes its place in an ARMADA, filling the English sky: 432 planes in a V-OF-V's-FORMATION, tightly bunched, occupying 300 miles of airspace. We CUT TO:
Cold and drafty in here. Some guys sleep; most just stare
Where ya from, Grunauer?
Miami. You?
Des Moines, Iowa.
Oh yeah? You a farmer? Ford chuckles every time Boyce has to answer that.
No. Worked at a filling station.
"Biggest one in all Des Moines." Tell him, Ed; it's practically a landmark.
Darn right. What's D.F. stand for? Grunauer hesitates. He's taken a lot of shit for his name
...Derwin Frances. A few guys snicker, Grunauer tightening - so:
Coulda been worse. Coulda stood for “Der Fuhrer." Grunauer laughs, Ford keeping it all light.
I got a cousin in Miami. He--

Hey, Boyce. Why you always chattin' everybody up all the time? This ain't a cruise-ship. Ford's reaction is instant: THE ICIEST GLARE OF ALL TIME: not mess with Boyce or you are messing with ME. It lands Tibbet instantly retreating:
Chat away. See if I give a damn. Ford is the Alpha in this stick. Silence hovers... until:

Hey. Look at that: Dawes just saw something, out the cargo door (it's open). sight that takes everybody's breath away: 1,000 feet below us. The English Channel. Alive with wake ...because there are 6,000 ARMED VESSELS sailing across i

This is the D-DAY INVASION FLEET, the greatest (and large amphibious force ever assembled. Destroyers, gunboats, tr transports - blanketing the channel. And we see awe on the faces in here - a sense of being a of something massive and historic. Pride too.
Look out, Hitler!
Hitler's dead. (everybody turns...) He just don't know it yet. That sums it up. The men nod, encouraged.
We're gonna be the first G.I.'s on European soil since this dust-up began - so let's make an impression. (MORE )
NO prisoners. You see ANYTHING German you fire on it.
Happy to.
(as if making a note:) "Fire at Germans." Got it.
Ford...
Yes, Sarge?
Anything happens to me tonight, you'll be in command. I expect you to keep your temper in check.
Sure thing, Sarge - long as nobody ticks me off. Rensin breathes out a laugh.

Just make sure that tower comes down. Ford nods soberly. Then, that fast, everything goes GRAY. We just plunged into a CLOUD. Gray all around us, like be in a vaccuum. The men tighten, anxiety droning. Then, new sounds, in the distance. DEEP THUDS and the CRA of TRACER-FIRE, which means we're crossing over the Frenc border, where the Germans are. And they have been waiting
The C-47 now plods into SEARCHLIGHT BEAMS from GERMAN ANT AIRCRAFT BATTERIES on the ground. That fast, 20 MM. SHELL shrieking into the sky, right at us.
BOOM. BOOM. Shells explode right outside this craft, jolt the beast back and forth. It creaks, it whines. The men k their eyes down. Boyce too. No one talking.
Just a little chop, Ladies! Jerry saying hello, nothin' to write home (MORE )
about. We sit tight until the jump- lights go on. He's pointing to the LIGHTS above the CARGO-BAY DOOR. One red, the other's green. Both are OFF now. Boyce eyes them
We stick together, awright?
You won't hafta look to find me.

LT. DAVE McKEAN, our pilot, looks right and left - can't ANYTHING but gray. Neither can his CO-PILOT or NAVIGATOR. We're shuddering, bouncing, like flying inside a blender. Then a brilliant, horrible BLAST turns everything WHITE. It's FLAK from those German batteries, exploding all arou us now. BURSTS of it erupt outside the cockpit window, jarring us badly. The C-47 shudders; noise fills the sky. Everything just ratcheted up in a hurry. McKean panicking
What's our time to drop-zone?!
I don't know, Skip! I can't get a fix! On the dash is a button, the JUMP-LIGHT. It's got three settings: OFF, RED, and GREEN. McKean eyes it... then:
I'm breaking formation. He DESCENDS 100 feet in a hurry and YOKES to the left, aw (presumably) from the other planes in the V.

The beast jerks to the left - sending every man tumbling. Sound and fury shaking this crate like a toy, everyone's stomach dropping in the rapid descent. Then we level out. And 18 TERRIFIED GUYS stare at the JUMP-LIGHTS over the d We can't see any other planes in our V, but we can hear t taking hits. The C-47 bounces violently, creaking in prot Then another sound - like rocks shaken inside a tin can:  12. It's 40 mm. fire from below - BLUE, GREEN, and RED TRACER lighting up the sky. Lethal whizzing sounds, everywhere. Then 88mm. SHELLS start exploding. BAH-BOOM. Death itself Each explosion concussive, jolting us: BAH-BOOM. BAH-BOOM No one on this plane believes we're going to survive. For can see that in the tense faces, the white knuckles. So h does what leaders do - raising his voice, and:
Guys, tell me something. On the level. 'Cause I don't know if I'm gonna get another chance to ask. Every head turns. He looks troubled, serious... until:

(re: his front parachute) Does this make me look fat? LAUGHTER erupts, big-time. Tension broken, just like that Boyce eyes Ford with awe. Then: --suddenly, TAT-TAT-TAT: Bullets from the machine-guns on
ground pierce our fuselage from below. PFC RIX (holding a FLAMETHROWER) is hit in the rump; he falls forward, howli
.-.as the RED JUMP-LIGHT above the cargo door pops ON. An

On your feet! Stand up and hook up! The men bounce up and hook the lines from their chutes to ANCHOR LINE running along the ceiling of the fuselage, forming a line that stretches back from the cargo-bay doo We hear them calling out, "Eighteen okay!" "Seventeen oka "Sixteen okay!" ...as MORE FLAK explodes, knocking guys o Ford keeps Boyce from falling as they approach the jump-l Then a HUGE BURST knocks us sideways. Ford falls forward. SECOND BURST hits our RIGHT-WING ENGINE; it DIES, belchin smoke. The C-47 lurches violently to the right.
More FLAK. More 40 mm. fire from below. Metal whizzing ar us. It's like a Goddamn shooting gallery in here--
You hit?!
Get to the line! Boyce hooks himself to the ANCHOR-LINE, fifth from the do Above it, that JUMP-LIGHT remains RED, the sky now a curt of EXPLODING FLAK. Grieb, at the bay-door, stares, shakin
In line! In line!
Sarge, there's nowhere to jump!
In line! Every man! We jump on GREEN! Everybody staring at that RED LIGHT, and the death out th
(to Dawes) Promise me, okay? If it looks like I'm about to be captured, put a bullet in my back.
Why would I do that?
I'd rather not find out how Nazis treat prisoners named Rosenfeld.
You're assuming we're gonna survive the jump. But Rosenfeld's look says, "I'm not kidding." Dawes nods, solemn promise - as Ford hooks up to the Anchor Line.

We emerge from CLOUDS at 150 m.p.h., with the sky on FIRE McKean, struggling with one working engine, reaches for t jump-light switch, the GREEN setting. Then, a horrible THUMP, on McKean's left. He looks out th window - and sees something that makes him blanch.
Good Christ...

Jumpmaster Rensin and Grieb are now staring at the same t that McKean just saw... and it's awful:  14. THEIR POV: THE LEFT WING - now draped by a PARACHUTE. .--Still attached to a PARATROOPER. Poor guy must've jump from a plane above us. Dead now, his body bucking in our wash, fouled by the lines of his chute. Horrible. Grieb gags. Boyce, fifth in line from the door, just star horrified. But Rensin gathers himself, faces his men, and

When you hit the ground, use your crickets to find the rest of your stick! Checkwords: "flash," "thunder," "welcome." Anybody doesn't answer back, you FIRE! We're gonna be SOUTH of our target! Use your maps and compass - but get to that church and take out that Goddamn TOWER! It-- Then he's GONE - EVISCERATED mid-word by EXPLODING FLAK.

A HUGE BOOM RIGHT OUTSIDE THE CARGO DOOR - blowing a hole our flank and taking Rensin and Grieb with it. Boyce's eyes go wide. There's no red light to watch anymo the Cargo Door is now a gaping HOLE. Everyone shocked. An ANOTHER HIT - our LEFT ENGINE NOW - it sputters, dying. And WE START TO DIVE. Sinking like a safe... Ford acts quickly, unhooking himself from the JUMP-LINE and:

Everybody out! GO GO GO! He pushes guys out the door: Dawes, Tibbet, Rosenfeld, Ch this is pure unrehearsed bravery. Grunauer, up next, stum to the floor. Ford rolls him out the door. Next up is Boyce - he hesitates, petrified.

Go! Go! Boyce goes... but first he grabs Ford and pulls him out t They fall into the night; a BLAST of air smacks them, yan Boyce's CHUTE open. The jolt rips Ford from Boyce's grasp A HUGE EXPLOSION ABOVE US. Our C-47 just disintegrated. B is suddenly alone, mid-air. Death everywhere. PIECES OF T PLANE now falling beside him - burning metal. A disaster.  15.

Boyce's eyes dart, trying to orient himself. Looking for or other chutes as he plummets amid smoke, noise, terror. Exploding FLAK, BULLETS whistling by, a WALL of tracer fi to his left. Where is Ford's Goddamn chute? The fuzzy outline of LAND below. It crystallizes as it ru up to meet us. Boyce braces himself for a THUD. Instead, a so SPLASH. And he VANISHES, just like that, in
WATER. He has fallen into a RIVER. It swallows him whole.

He opens his eyes, shocked. Loaded with gear, fouled by h lines. I'm going to drown. Holy Hell. I need air! He feels for the river bed beneath his feet. There it is. coils his legs, springs up. Above him is the surface. His head breaches for half a second, under his CHUTE. He gulps in a breath, then sinks like a stone again. Under water, he reaches for his TRENCH KNIFE. Grabs it-- And fumbles it. Shit! It sinks, fast. He drops down after hits bottom, searching and fumbling amidst RIVER SILT. No light down here at all - grasping urgently, blindly. .--but he finds it, holds on tight, pushes himself up aga ..-another stolen GASP of air. Then down again. He starts sawing away at the straps of his CHUTE-HARNESS. He cuts through one, then the other, cuts his MUSETTE BAG loose, drops his mines, and - buoyant now - bounces up ag EXT. RIVERBANK —- CONTINUING (NIGHT) His head clears the surface, then his chest. He drags him onto the RIVERBANK. Drenched, gasping. --doesn't see anyone. But he can hear GUNFIRE in the wood Overhead he sees C-47's, most of them laboring, some of t smoking. Parachutes in the distance. He gets to his feet. JUMP-CUTS: He assembles his RIFLE. Checks his ammo, grena COMPASS (north, go north). Then he rises - and moves towa  16.

He stays low - wet grass underfoot, gunfire in the distan From his pants he extracts that DIME-STORE METAL CRICKET. chirps it twice. CLICK-CLACK. CLICK-CLACK. No one replies Up ahead, he sees a billow of WHITE against the dull eart Another chute. Please be Lew. He heads toward it while chirping that CRICKET again. No reply. Two more tries. Ag nothing. His hands squeeze his rifle tighter. He gets to the chute; there's a SHAPE under it. A body? H pulls the chute away. A PARATROOPER lies here, FACE DOWN. Boyce braces himself, turns the body over... It's Dawes - eyes closed. Boyce shakes him:
Dawes. Dawes! You okay? Dawes' eyes open. Disoriented - but instantly on mission:
Where's Rosenfeld? You got him?
No. Are you hurt?
No. Head's ringing a little.

Let's go. We gotta find everybody. They move north, slowly, along the wet grass, chirping th metal CRICKETS. In the night we hear REPEATED BURSTS of GUNFIRE, mini-battles flaring up all through the woods. ...-staying low, everything tensed, clicking their CRICKE Then they hear ANOTHER CRICKET chirp back. They pause. BOYCE (CONT’D) Flash.
Thunder.
Welcome. Tibbet emerges from behind a tree, relieved to see them.  17.
Tibbet. Ya see anybody else?
No. How many of us made it out?
I don't know.
Christ. Did Gurkin make it? He had the explosives.
I don't know. Didn't see him.
Where's Ford? Thought you two were joined at the hip.
Don't be an asshole, Tibbet. More GUNFIRE in the distance. ABOVE US A STRICKEN C-47 SUDDENLY FALLS FROM THE SKY, on fire - right at us.

Hit it! Boyce, Dawes, and Tibbet hit the dirt, covering their hea The FLAMING C-47 crashes behind them, EXPLODING on impact There's nothing left of it. Good God. But it throws enoug FIRELIGHT to show us a PARACHUTE stuck in a NEARBY TREE t stands along a country lane, ROAD 13. The guys get to their feet and head for that tree. GUNFIR echoes in the DISTANCE. They cross over Road 13, to:
They look up at the PARACHUTE stuck in its upper branches and a pair of LEGS dangling. Boyce whispers loudly:
Flash.
Thunder! Wait. That's Ford's voice. They look up:
Lew!  18. Yep. It's Ford, stuck in this tree, 20 feet up, his left pinned at an odd angle by all his gear. He can't move it.
Ed. Jesus. Can someone get me down? My arm's pinned.
(starts climbing) Yeah. Just hang on.
Did the detonator get banged up?
It's fine. I'm fine too, by the way.

Make it fast - awright, Boyce? Boyce climbs, his head on a swivel - feels awfully VISIBL but that's his buddy up there... More GUNFIRE in the nigh Boyce keeps climbing. He's 15 feet off the ground, when:
Ed! Boyce turns - and it happens in a flash: TWO WEHRMACHT SOLDIERS appear from the road.

Boyce, clinging to that tree, grabs at his RIFLE. It fall ++.-JjJust as the Germans start firing. But-- Ford, suspended 20 FEET in the air, draws his SIDEARM wit his right hand and FIRES - TWO SHOTS. And the Germans FALL, both of them. Just like that. Dead. Boyce doesn't move at first. It still feels unreal... The
Aw Christ... Boyce looks down. Dawes is dead. HEAD-SHOT. Tibbet stands beside the body - unharmed but badly shaken.
You okay, Tibbet? (Tibbet half-nods) Ed, get up here and cut me loose before anybody else drops by. Gotta take that tower out.  19. Boyce starts climbing again, so disappointed in himself.
Boyce arrives at the top, Ford calm and ever-vigilant.
Good shooting.
Dumb luck. Get me outta here. Boyce takes out his KNIFE, saws at the chute lines.
I couldn't get to my rifle. Ya got a grip on that branch?
Yeah.
‘Kay. Here goes. Boyce cuts another line, freeing Ford... But Ford didn't a good grip on the branch - and he falls, straight down.

Lew! Boyce catches him, Ford slamming into the TREE. The IMPAC causes something to shake from his belt - that DETONATOR. It's dense metal, canteen-sized, falling like an anvil to Tibbet who is kneeling over Dawes to remove Dawes' dog-ta
Heads up! Tibbet moves just in time, the detonator lands beside him

Goddammit! Boyce and Ford trade a look - two G.I.'s, hanging on - in middle of the forest in the middle of the night in the mi of a war. Ford calmly reaches for the tree-trunk. ..-and shimmies down. Boyce follows, speechless as ever a Ford's unflappable calm. They reach the ground.
Dawes lies at their feet. 20 feet away lie the two German  20. The air above crackles with tracer fire, flak, dying C-47 Ford eyes that DETONATOR, puts it back on his belt.
Good as new.
Almost took my damn head off.
Yeah, that woulda been a shame. Tibbet doesn't reply. Ford takes Dawes' GRENADES and AMMO unfolds his SILK MAP again.
Like to know where the hell we are.

Sarge said we were south of the-- Suddenly, Boyce FREEZES - MORE FOOTSTEPS COMING. Fainter. Lighter. Just one person now. But he's coming right this Ford, Boyce, and Tibbet hit the dirt - keeping their head and rifles ready. Silent... Waiting... The FOOTSTEPS getting closer... Closer... Hand push some branches aside - 20 feet from here... revealing A girl of 19, coming from the road. This is CHLOE LAURENT She's French, lovely, but hardened by war and loss - terr too. The G.I.'s stay low, invisible to her, as: She stops beside a nearby TREE, where we now see an ANIMA TRAP, a dead SQUIRREL inside. Chloe opens the trap - it's heavy, rusty, but she's strong. She puts the squirrel carcass in a satchel, resets the tr Then she spots the DEAD GERMANS, and moves toward them... With our guys watching, she starts rifling through their pockets. That fast she's taken pistols, ammo, gloves, scarves, rings, mess-kits. Chloe's a scavenger. Ford and Boyce silently eye one another... Then Chloe FREEZES - just heard something. She turns. ...to find THREE RIFLES pointing at her. Her hands go up.  21.
Allemagne?
Non! Non! Je suis-- The G.I.'s get to their feet. They're American. That chan everything. She exclaims, in accented ENGLISH:
You're here! My God! That fast she starts sobbing, hard, as if she'd been free from Dachau. She rushes over to hug them. Ford steps back
Where are we? (Chloe keeps sobbing) Where are we?
(thru tears) Outside Cielblanc.
Is this Road Thirteen?
Yes.
Where's the coast?
Three kilometers, that way. Ford and Boyce brush past her, moving some foliage aside: town of Cielblanc is a tiny dot, nearly a mile from here.
You seen any other G.I.'s out here?

(so hopeful) This was your target? Cielblanc? You liberate us? They don't answer. Overhead, more planes groan. Then Ford stiffens. Just heard something else: A VEHICLE, approaching. Ford and Boyce know that sound.  22.
German half-track. Shit... A HALF-TRACK, and it's getting closer, lurching up Road 1 They reach for their GRENADES, looking for somewhere to h
No. Play dead.
Like Hell we will.

Please, listen to me. If they get you we'll never be free of them. Ford whips around, looking for a hiding spot. Then he stops. Truth is there's no better option out here and he knows it. So, although he HATES this plan... He leans back. Boyce and Tibbet too, their eyes SHUT. For turns his back to the road - his eyes OPEN - positioning TRENCH-KNIFE like a mirror so he can see the road, as:

(whispered, bitter) "What'd you do in the war, Grandpa?" Boyce eyes him: "Sssshhh." Ford goes stone-still. The HALF-TRACK pulls toward us - a truck with TANK TREADS back, WHEELS up front, mounted MACHINE-GUNS. And SIX GERM SOLDIERS, scanning the ground for movement. Chloe, playing her part, rifles through Dawes' pockets li the scavenger she is. Her hands are shaking with fear. Boyce lies still, his eyes cracking open enough to see Fo ..-who is watching Chloe while fingering the trigger on h side-arm. Boyce eyes the DEAD SQUIRREL poking out of Chlo bag. A bad omen... The Half-Track getting closer, when... DISASTER: The HALF-TRACK STOPS. Right here. A SERGEANT hollers at C in German. She replies meekly. He shouts again, ordering And Chloe rises... leaving the G.I. "bodies" behind - For Boyce, and Tibbet completely abandoned now...

Boyce awakens in this huge space. Looks around, disorient He's on an OPERATING TABLE - his hands and feet tied to i legs. A nearby SURGICAL TRAY bears a SCALPEL and SYRINGES Around him are the Villager-Creatures, tied to their beds black tar being pumped through their veins by Autojectors .+-black blood draining from them into bottles on the flo Bed #3 remains toppled over, its patient still tied to it The 25 GERMANS remain on their granite slabs across the l The GAS STOVE is on again, black blood boiling in a vial. Rosenfeld's bed is beside Boyce's. Their eyes meet. Then, BANGING SOUND. Boyce turns: It's Bruel, using a MALLET to crush TWO US-ARMY DETONATOR Shit. Bruel drops the mallet and turns, twitching slightl his eyes on Boyce... Then Bruel grabs a SYRINGE. Boyce braces himself. Bruel finds a VEIN in Boyce's arm. goes the needle... Bruel drawing blood, as:
So, Private. Why are you here? Their eyes meet. Bruel's English is surprisingly unaccent

It's the invasion - and yet you're sent to this tiny village. Why? This was a mission? (Boyce is silent) You were obviously intending to blow up something, Private; we found four blocks of tetrytol on one of your fellow soldiers - and you and your Hebrew friend here were carrying detonators. What was your target? Again, no reply. Bruel produces the SS DEATH'S-HEAD DAGGE that Boyce found on the ramp, eyeing it fondly. Shit.  67.

The tower on the roof? Was that it? (Boyce is silent) Was it something else? Boyce just stares. We DRIFT DOWN to find his right wrist, tied to that table-leg. There's a tiny bit of play in the knot. So Boyce wiggles it, as invisibly as possible, whil

Were you perhaps sent to target me? This lab? He studies Boyce for a reaction. None. Then he grabs a CRANIOMETER (standard German phrenology instrument), and begins to measure Boyce's skull with it, as:
Do you come from Nordic stock by any chance? Parents? Grandparents? Anyone in your bloodline Teutonic? We're always looking for candidates for our re-Germanization program.
(re: Villager-Creatures) Are they being re-Germanized too? At last, a response. Bruel breathes out a grin.
They are contributing to the war effort in ways you could hardly imagine.
How?
I'll ask the questions, if you don't mind. He tears Boyce's t-shirt away, lights his cigarette light
Again. Why are you here? He puts the blade of the SS dagger into the flame. The DAGGER glows red. Boyce tries not to react. Impossibl
It won't hurt, you know - telling me. But this...  68. Boyce prays for strength. Bruel grabs the CROSS hanging around Boyce's neck and YANKS IT FREE, tossing it away.
Why're you doing this? You're French.
Am I?
S'posed to be a doctor.
I am a soldier now! Ensuring the Thousand-Year Reich! Himmler's dug up half of Europe looking for the secret - and I've found it for him!
Secret to what?
History. He PRESSES THE RED-HOT BLADE FLAT ONTO BOYCE'S BELLY. Boy howls - the pain unimaginable...
Boyce keeps praying, but Bruel does it again, red-hot ste onto bare flesh. Rosenfeld cringing at the sight...
(Boyce crying)

head_text.subj: I'VE WON THE WAR FOR THEM, YOU
AND YOU WILL NOT TAKE THAT FROM ME

text: Boyce in sheer agony, aching, crying... but he isn't talk Behind Bruel, that POT BOILS OVER. He turns, irritated, t hurries toward it - giving Boyce a brief reprieve. At the stove, Bruel pulls the vial of black BLOOD from th boiling water. Then draws the blood into a SYRINGE. Ten feet away, Boyce begins to work the rope again. Urgen Bruel, his syringe full now, turns.  69. Boyce moans loudly, as if delirious with pain. Bruel, pleased, carries the syringe - not toward Boyce bu instead toward one of those dead Boxer-Wearers on the sla this guy's name is/was SCHERZER. Boyce goes back to work, struggling to loosen the rope, a Bruel injects the hot blood into Scherzer's HEART. Boyce keeps working on the rope... Almost there... Bruel finishes the injection on Scherzer. Turns. ..-Boyce's hand isn't free yet. Rosenfeld sees that, so:
Water... Bruel pauses as if he'd misheard.
What?
Bruel approaches Rosenfeld. Mutual, utter contempt.
Just like a Jew, demanding that to which you have no claim. .+-which allows Boyce to keep working his wrist urgently,
Water. S'il vous plait. Bruel backhands Rosenfeld across the face - just as Boyce hand_comes free. Rosenfeld keeps at it:
Okay, wine then. A nice French Bordeaux maybe--
Silence! Bruel slugs him, hard - then turns to face Boyce... who continues to writhe as if delirious. Bruel stands over him... and draws that SS DAGGER again.  70.
Smile, Private. There's no greater honor than dying for your country.
‘Least I have one. .+-which is when Bruel notices an oddity - something's missing from the surgical tray - one ITEM, gone.

--but just as Bruel realizes it, BOYCE STRIKES in a BLUR JAMMING THAT SCALPEL into Bruel's neck. Bruel falls, gasp Boyce frees his other hand. Sits up, frees his legs, grab his RIFLE and fires a bullet into Bruel's chest.
Can you walk, Rosenfeld? Rosenfeld shakes his head. Shit. There isn't much time.

Ford enters the LESNER BARN. There's her TRUCK. He advanc .-.-and is immediately CLUBBED FROM BEHIND by a SHOVEL. H staggers, falls, turns... Evy Lesner stands here, gruesome face and all. She grabs Ford's RIFLE, points it at him. --IN THE LAB - Boyce hurries to the LAST CABINET in a row It's locked. He knocks the lock off with his rifle-butt. Inside, the four Tetrytol blocks. He grabs them, turns. On that STOVE: vials, more SYRINGES. He heads over-- --BACK TO THE BARN - Ford struggles to his feet, supporte that crutch. Lesner, rifle ready, hisses at him in French

Listen, Lady, I don't speak much French. Why don't you put that thing down before somebody gets hurt? (Lesner is unmoved) Friends, okay? Amie? Lesner eyes him with contempt. He reaches into his pocket

Chocolate? He offers his spare BAR of it to her. She lowers the rifl  71. Then she FIRES IT - right into Ford's bad ankle. BACK TO BOYCE - At the stove. He hears the shot; it snaps head around. BACK TO FORD - He drops to the ground, his leg a rag-doll BACK TO BOYCE - panicked, he runs to Rosenfeld.

That could be Lew! We gotta go! Rosenfeld can't move. Boyce grabs him in a FIREMAN'S CARR and heads out, moving right past those GRANITE SLABS. On SLAB #1 is Scherzer, recipient of the hot-blood inject He just blinked. BACK TO FORD - on his back. Lesner drifts over, reaches f his TRENCH-KNIFE, taking her eyes off Ford for just a sec Big mistake. He grabs her hair and yanks her to the groun That fast it's an ugly, feral wrestling match. Her BLACKE FINGERS clawing at him. Hair is grabbed, faces gouged. He loosens her grip on the rifle and tosses it away... as:

Boyce carries Rosenfeld through. Up ahead is the BACK DOO that he blew open with that grenade. He heads toward it.. BACK TO THE BARN - Ford and Lesner struggle on the floor animals. Gouging, scratching, smothering, gasping...

Boyce crosses the grounds, bearing Rosenfeld. BACK TO THE BARN - A primal struggle. Lesner rolls on top Ford, her hand under his chin, trying to snap his neck. Ford's trying to snap hers. Both of them panting. Eyes locked, the sounds guttural. He's stronger, but she' got leverage on her side - gravity too. She growls as-- .-+-a Single liquid SNAP... And Lesner's body sags on top of Ford's. Neck broken.

Boyce heads down the foothill, carrying Rosenfeld.  72. BACK TO THE BARN - Ford pushes Lesner's twisted body away tumbles off of him like a mannequin. He tears her SHIRT o to tourniquet his gushing leg, as we:

Boyce reaches the square, unaware that Ford's in the barn BACK TO FORD - He crawls to his CRUTCH, gets to his feet, gathers his rifle, then to the barn door - in time to see --BOYCE, lugging Rosenfeld into the Laurent home. BACK TO FORD - He hears a NOISE behind him - turns... and jaw drops - utter shock and horror. ...as Lesner's body starts decaying, right before his eye Her SKIN-BLISTERS begin to BUBBLE, as if CORRODING from t inside. A SOUND comes from her, like a hissed death-rattl spitting out of her lungs. The CORROSION continues-—- ..-eating not just her face now but every inch of her leg her torso, her neck - they all decay, with Ford bearing witness - a sizzling sound as the flesh gives way... Soon she looks like a piece of burned paper. Then she's m ASH inside clothing... Ford is awed, afraid. But he swallows it all.
Boyce enters, lays Rosenfeld across the Dining Table.
Lew!? Lew!? No reply from the attic. But Chloe emerges from her room:
This man needs help! She nods. He hurries to the attic steps:
Lew?! Lew?!
He went out - to help you!
What?!  73.
Ford hobbles through the empty Square, to the Laurent hom The sounds of D-DAY thumping in the distance...
Boyce moves to the door, adrenaline rocketing through him
Lew?! He throws it open, just as Ford hobbles in. Instant relie
Thank God. You don't-- Christ, what happened to your leg?
I got shot-- (at Chloe) --your friend with the truck. Then she turned to ash. Was something wrong with the ordnance?
Whaddaya mean she turned to ash--
I mean she shriveled up like a piece of burnt confetti.
I don't--
Yes or no? Was something wrong with the ordnance?
They study one another, Ford all-business.
No. Nothin' wrong with it.
Then why's that tower still standing? That sounded angry. Truth is, Ford's just reeling.
I... I heard the gunfire, thought you might be in trouble.  74.
For the last time, it doesn't fucking matter if I'm in trouble! The mission is the tower! When're ya gonna get it through that hayseed head of yours?
That hurt, but Boyce doesn't fire back. He can't. Instead just heads up the attic steps.
Where you going?
Got a couple questions for our prisoner.
It's 8:25 already.
I know what time it is.
Boyce arrives, pulls out the SYRINGE he took from the lab and a vial of BLACK BLOOD. He thrusts them at Wafner.
What does this stuff do? (Wafner's silent) That doctor said it was gonna ensure the Thousand-Year Reich. What was he talking about? Again, no reply. Boyce, rattled, puts a GUN to his head.
You've got one minute. TALK. Pretty aggressive move. Ford and Chloe appear at the top the steps. They haven't seen this side of Boyce before.
What's the black blood for?
You saw it. Don't you know? Yes, Boyce knows - but he's silent. Wafner grins...
What's he talking about, Ed?  75.

I dunno; they got a dozen villagers in there - like her grandma, but worse - tied up, bleeding into bottles. The doctor injected some of the blood into a... (reluctantly...) ...dead guy. Wafner smiles a knowing smile. Ford eyes him..
Why would he do that? Wafner enjoying every second of this--
You want a Thousand-Year Reich, you need a Thousand-Year Army. You see? That lands with a THUD. Boyce and Ford silent... A beat... trying to digest the idea. It goes down hard...
It's been there for ages, you know. The tar. Ask her, she'll tell you. All we did was dig it up...
(at Chloe) You knew all this? All eyes on Chloe. She looks as lost as they are...
(dazed...) We heard stories about it, my whole life. The black river under the hill. But they were just stories... Silence - Ford and Boyce still processing all this...

Credit that doctor - there were so many failed attempts before he learned how to use it, but he's tireless. If his countryman had worked half as hard to defend France, we wouldn't be here today. Boyce shakes his head. Ford just smoldering...  76.
It can't be.
Think of it. An inexhaustible army.
It can't be.
There's a way to find out. Huh? Ford grabs his TRENCH-KNIFE and approaches Wafner. ...-whose smile suddenly VANISHES - just realized: This g about to kill me! He's right. Ford hobbles past Chloe, as
But I told you everything!
Hold it, Lew. What're you doing?
Playing doctor.
Why? Let's just blow up the tower and-
Need to know what we're up against. (at Wafner) Don't we.
I don't-- I'm just a soldier! (Ford about to strike)
THWUMP! Ford jams the dagger deep into Wafner's CHEST. Silence hangs. Boyce can't fucking believe it.
Now you're an experiment. Wafner's not breathing. Chloe and Boyce shocked-- Ford puts his head to Wafner's chest. Wafner's dead. Ford reaches for the SYRINGE. Boyce hands it over, speechless,
"Fire at Germans," remember?  77. He fills it with BLACK BLOOD from the vial. Boyce dazed:
.»+-goes in his heart. Ford jams it into Wafner's heart, hits the plunger... and nothing happens. A long beat. Wafner's just dead...
We killing P.O.W.'s now?
You don't think the Nazis've killed any P.O.W.'s?
Sure. That's what makes ‘em Nazis. But we aren't like them, right?
Nobody ever won a war by saying please and thank you, Ed. He knew that.
Meanwhile it didn't get us anywhere. Look at him.
I'm lookin'. My opinion, it's an improvement.
Point is, we don't do this.
We do now. (studying Wafner...) Dose mighta been too small-- Then a SHOCK: WAFNER'S EYES FLY OPEN. HIS HEAD POPS UP. H CHEST EXPANDS. The blood from his wounds suddenly BLACK--
He just RE-SET TO THE EXACT MOMENT BEFORE HE WAS KILLED. Otherwise, he's okay. Breathing. Alive.
Lew...? Boyce and Ford stare at each other in silence, awestruck. Ford - first time ever - doesn't know what to say. Chloe  78.
Lew...? Ford just shakes his head... ...as Wafner sees the KNIFE in his chest, the BLACK BLOOD around it... and the syringe in Ford's hand. And an awful realization hits. I was dead. He eyes Ford--
You... killed me?
Listen, Pal-- Wafner YANKS A HAND FREE, pulls the dagger from his chest cuts his ROPES LOOSE - and RISES, his eyes murderous.
You killed me.
Well, yeah, but in all fairness I also brought you back. Now sit down. (Wafner doesn't) I said SIDDOWN, Asshole. Every part of Boyce tensing. Wafner turns to them--
You see now? A Thousand-Year Army for a Thousand-Year Reich! ...as Wafner starts toward Ford--

Listen, Pal - I wasn't that crazy about you the FIRST time around; don't make me kill you again. Wafner smiles... then charges Ford - pushing Chloe aside- In a blur, Ford fires at him - BANG, in the arm. Great... except Wafner keeps coming. Unaffected. Unharmed And the BLOOD spurting from his arm is now as BLACK AS PI
Huh? Chloe screams. Boyce looks to Ford.

Lew!  79. Ford FIRES AGAIN. Hits Wafner in the CHEST. More BLACK BL And STILL NO EFFECT - Wafner just as shocked by all this they are. Boyce swings that CHAIR at Wafner, striking him over the head with it. It shatters. Again, he's unaffecte So Ford SHOOTS HIM IN THE HEAD. That oughtta do it... But the wound bleeds BLACK. And Wafner, after a pause, sh it off and keeps coming. Somehow. He starts RANTING now, in German. We don't understand a w of it but it sounds like something from a nazi rally. Boyce, dazed, looks at that SYRINGE on the floor... and h and Ford both come to the same horrible conclusion: They've just turned this German into something unkillable And what he wants... is Chloe. In an ugly way. He grabs h throws her over his shoulder.

Chloe! Boyce jumps in Wafner's path, tries to pull Chloe away-- Wafner BULLS FORWARD, using Chloe like shoulder-pads, int Boyce. And there's nothing behind Boyce but those STAIRS. Boyce goes flying - tumbling - landing hard at the base o the attic steps. Ford gets to his feet. Wafner kicks him, knocking him dow .+-and carries Chloe down those steps. She's shrieking, "MAMA!!!" And grabbing at the railing on each side of her trying to slow him down. Can't be done. Ford scrambles to get another clean shot - his eyes meeti Chloe. He can't fire again without hitting her.

Boyce, at the base of the steps, sees Wafner coming, draw his SIDE-ARM, fires THREE SHOTS into Wafner's belly. BLACK BLOOD oozes from Wafner's gut. A mere annoyance. He steps OVER Boyce, heading for the door. Chloe screaming. Rosenfeld reaches for a sidearm - but doesn't have one. The rest of Chloe's family emerges now - to see Wafner he for the door. Chloe screaming. Boyce gets to his feet.  80. --Ford thumping his way down the stairs-- Wafner reaches the door, opens it. An insane moment. He carries her away, Chloe screaming:

Chloe!!! Into the Square, her voice ringing in our ears, sheer ter Ford hits the last step - but too late - Chloe's family i tatters, her SCREAMS still audible. Then: CRASH - a German grenade (called a "POTATO-MASHER") is to by Wafner through the window. Boyce scrambles for it-- --as Ford dives on top of Paul. --and Rosenfeld hits the deck. Boyce tosses it out of the room - it EXPLODES - loud. Destructive. But no one's hit. Boyce rushes to the window. Wafner is halfway up the hill And here we are, in a house that's seen a grenade explosi and an abduction. Pure shock. Boyce and Ford trade a look
You got the charges? (Boyce half-nods...) Let's go. It's time to take out our Goddamn target and get Chloe the hell outta there.
What're you gonna use for a detonator?
Whaddaya mean?
The Doctor bashed both of ‘em in. Ford considers that... Then:
I can get us a detonator.  81.
How?
Let's go. Still got thirty minutes before our planes are in the air. D-Day pounding. They head for the door, Ford on his crutc
On one leg?
It's the mission, ain't it? That had some edge. He nears the door. Boyce follows...
You help my daughter!
Boyce and Ford emerge from behind a barn. They're just ab to approach the PASTURE - when Boyce STOPS Ford.
What?
Mines. Watch your step. Ford nods, thanks. We CRANE UP, Boyce leading a hobbled F through this mine-ridden PASTURE, toward that foothill... The church sits atop it. The guns of D-Day pounding. Then
Boyce and Ford stand where Boyce stood last night: at the of the EARTHEN RAMP leading into the FOOTHILL itself. The BLAST-DOORS are open. Boyce eyes them...
Listen, I don't know what's down there. Could be more of ‘em, could be anything.
Piece 'a cake.
Right. And half the German grenades are duds. We don't know how to kill these things, Lew...  82.
Keep it down. They might catch wise.
Yeah, then we'd really be in trouble. Ford grins, about to march - when Boyce gags involuntaril just barely stopped himself from vomiting. Ford eyes him.
Sorry. Shit. (a beat...) Don't you ever get scared?
‘Course. Everybody does. Know what scares me worse? Some guy on Omaha Beach buyin' it 'cause I didn't get my job done. Rather die right here. Wouldn't you?
I'm not so sure we're put together the same way. My old man wouldn't've run into a burning building to save five strangers. I don't think I would either.

Hey, forget what my old man did. It's too much to live up to, believe me. That came out before Ford could stop it. Now it hovers... FORD (CONT’D) Screw this. It's D-Day. Let's go. They descend down the ramp, toward DARKNESS. ...crossing under the ANCIENT RUNIC SYMBOLS and the SWAST One last look at the symbols, wondering what they mean. T Ford and Boyce vanish into the pitch of the Cavern... INT. CAVERN UNDER THE CHURCH —- CONTINUING It's big. First thing we see down here is a burned-out TR the one that carried in all those German bodies. Beside it we find TWO CHARRED CORPSES. It's hard to say f sure, but one of them looks it was once a German soldier. other looks like it might've been Penner. Gruesome. Ford and Boyce move around a corner... to find:  83. A DERRICK, pumping something from a BIG HOLE IN THE GROUN A HOSE from the derrick is connected to a large BARREL, w is OVERFLOWING with a thick black substance. Tar. Trouble is, there's a GERMAN standing beside the derrick- It's Scherzer, the guy who received the injection from Br Scherzer's still in his white boxers, his back to us, sta down into the HOLE from which that derrick is pumping... There's a GAPING WOUND across his back. Clearly, it's wha killed him. But he's alive now, the BLOOD from that wound calcified black. So how do we kill him??? Boyce and Ford trade a silent look. Boyce raises his rifl aiming... but Ford stops him with a silent headshake. The no point in trying to shoot this guy. Then Ford sees it... affixed to a wall: The FIRE HOSE. Boyce saw it used last night. Ford crutche toward it. Boyce follows. The hose is coiled around a WHE Boyce starts to UNCOIL IT. It squeaks, LOUD. He stops. Scherzer, twenty feet away, doesn't turn - just staring i whatever is down there, obviously unsettled. Ford moves to the FAUCET - a red knob. He indicates to Bo "When I turn this knob, you start RUNNING TO UNCOIL THE HOSE." Boyce nods. A moment, their eyes locked, then-- FORD TURNS THE RED KNOB - loud and squeaky. Scherzer turns at the sound-- Boyce starts running at him with the hose. Scherzer reaching for his RIFLE. Ford turning the knob harder - full blast. The hose UNCOILING off the wheel as fast as Boyce can run WATER EXPLODING OUT OF THE NOZZLE - too hard - the burst actually knocking Boyce off his feet. Scherzer grabs the rifle, turns to fire, YELLING-- ++.asS Boyce gets to one knee, aiming the hose, and...  84. BAM - it hits Scherzer in the chest - just as he FIRES. BANG - the bullet hitting a JUNCTION BOX a foot to Ford's left. Instantly, the POWER GOES OUT. And Scherzer is knocked off his feet, right into: ...the HOLE IN THE GROUND beside the derrick. Gone. A beat. Ford turns the water off. Boyce lowers the hose. And they move in, cautiously, toward the edge of the hole Ford crutching his way there... Then he looks down to see .+.-a POOL OF BLACK GUNK below. Scherzer's HAND sticking
Now he knows what it tastes like. A beat... Then Ford takes out his father's ZIPPO, lights it... and holds the flame to that overflowing barrel.
What're you doing?

If it'll burn, we gotta burn it. I wouldn't even want our side to know what this stuff can do. That fast, the TAR in the barrel IGNITES, highly flammabl The flames dance across that HOSE, through the DERRICK, t down into the hole just as-- JUMP-SCARE: Scherzer reaches up out of the tar - gasping. But the tar-pool ignites - a MASSIVE WALL OF FLAME ERUPTI FROM IT, knocking Boyce and Ford on their asses. The FLAM ROAR OUT... then suck back down again. Boyce and Ford crawl to the hole, look down - the CHARRED REMAINS OF SCHERZER seared into place among the flames. FORD (CONT’D) Guess they burn too. Boyce rises, offers his hand - just like Ford pulled Boyc onto that C-47 last night. Ford takes the hand, as-- A STAIRWELL DOOR OPENS, ten feet away. Here's Kiebel, ano guy we killed once before - checking on that JUNCTION BOX But he sees Boyce, and Ford, and the FIRE.  85. And he charges them - unarmed but roaring-- Boyce and Ford FIRE THEIR RIFLES out of instinct. It does make a dent. Black blood spurting from his wounds, Kiebel barrels into them both. Ford falls hard. Boyce and Kiebel tumble together to the cavern floor, RIGHT BY THE SURGING FLAMES. Kiebel's on top of Boyce in a hurry, hands around Boyce's throat - trying to choke him out. Boyce can't stop him - Nazi is undead and way too strong. The heat is scorching. Ford jumps on Kiebel's back, grabs Kiebel's head, pulling hard as Boyce gasps for breath. Ford TUGS. We hear that s single liquid SNAP we heard from Lesner when her neck bro ...except Kiebel doesn't stop. With his HEAD now dangling an unnatural angle, he keeps strangling Boyce. Ford, no choice, SLITS KIEBEL'S THROAT... Now black blood gushes from it onto Boyce. And STILL KIEBEL DOESN'T STOP. He's a monster, literally his grip on Boyce's throat unrelenting. Barking in German Ford, no moves left, pulls out his SIDE-ARM and fires it right into Kiebel's right WRIST. The bone shatters. Then LEFT WRIST. That bone shatters too. His grip on Boyce loosens. Boyce sucks in a breath. Then huge burst of energy - pushing Kiebel away and-- ...toward the edge of that hole, into the FLAMES. Kiebel's CLOTHES ignite. One MORE PUSH from Boyce and-- Kiebel vanishes down the hole, SCREECHING as he falls. And it's over. Ford and Boyce eye one another - Boyce now drenched in the black blood of a dead Nazi.
See? Simple. Boyce, soaked in black, just eyes him--
Stairs're over there.
Twenty minutes. Boyce nods. Ford follows him to the stairwell door.  86.
They climb in darkness (the LIGHT BULB in here now useles Ford struggling up the steps. They reach the DOOR leading to the basement. Boyce nudges open with the tip of his rifle, revealing:

We were here before. But now none of the LIGHTS are worki Rooms to our right and left. All dark now. Boyce is about step into the hallway when-- A FLASHLIGHT BEAM whips past his nose. He moves back. ...to find Wafner hurrying past this door - heading AWAY the LAB. No sign of Chloe. Wafner vanishes down the hall. Boyce follows. Ford stops him. And this is in WHISPERS:
He's got Chloe.

Chloe ain't the mission. That landed. Boyce nods... then: They step into the dark HALLWAY, toward the LAB. Boyce nu open the door to the ARMORY - pointing it out to Ford. Ford silently leans in, turns on his FLASHLIGHT-- Boyce alone in the hallway now, his head on a swivel-- Ford returns, bearing SIX GERMAN POTATO MASHERS. Gives th to Boyce, pockets three for himself. They continue along- ..+.to the LAB DOOR. Boyce nudges it open.

BLACK. Boyce and Ford stay low. Boyce shines his FLASHLIG into the space - illuminating it for Ford in brief bursts The creature/villagers, tied to their beds. The autojecto The CONCRETE SLABS where those 25 DEAD GERMANS WERE-- Whoops. FIVE OF THE SLABS ARE UNOCCUPIED... Boyce reacts, instantly shining his flashlight on the spo where he left Bruel's BODY. Bruel isn't there anymore.  87.
Got six unaccounted for--
Let's just get these charges set. He heads for the back wall - Boyce watching.
Lew. Tower's up on the roof.

Tower ain't enough anymore, Ed. This whole place has to come down. Boyce eyes the Villager-Subjects. Heads toward them-- Ford heads for the BACK WALL, passing by that SEVERED DOG HEAD, kept alive by the Autojector. He can't resist: FORD (CONT’D) (at the dog-head) Stay. The head, of course, doesn't move. Boyce begins to UNTIE THE CREATURE from Bed #1. A FEMALE, face completely blistered-black. Boyce frees her hands.

Go. Allez. She doesn't move. Maybe she can't. Maybe she's deaf. He unties her feet. Still no movement. Ford, at the back wall, removes a TETRYTOL BLOCK from his trousers, fixes it on the wall. Boyce moves to BED #2. A male, equally gruesome. Boyce st to untie his wrists. The creature GROWLS like an animal. Boyce recoils a bit, but he finishes, then moves on. BED #3 is still toppled on its side, its tortured inhabit stuck there. Boyce moves nearer, untying the guy: a semi- human nightmare under all that blistered flesh. Then, disaster: the LAB-DOOR OPENS. Two GERMAN SOLDIERS b in. Boyce shuts his flashlight off. Ford too - but too la The GERMANS OPEN UP ON HIM, machine-gun fire. Ford spins away, falling to the floor. The machine-gun fi continues, the Germans HOLLERING at him. (They were on th slabs an hour ago - dressed in their uniforms now).  88. Boyce drops - the Germans don't seem to know he's here. They start moving in on Ford's position, firing continual He doesn't return fire. These guys are SCREAMING. Boyce, on hands and knees, scrambles toward them. He pull PIN on one of his POTATO MASHERS, slides it along the flo It blows up at the FEET of the Germans - but they DON'T S still firing at Ford, shouting. Now what? Boyce looks around, sees something, crawls to i There, those CEREMONIAL AXES, affixed to the wall. He get his feet, grabs one - the noise drowned out by the TORREN machine-gun fire.
